### getParamAccesses() {#abc6fcee230630c48fcd48962768e7bcb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::vector&lt; FunctionSummary::ParamAccess &gt; StackSafetyInfo::getParamAccesses (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/modulesummaryindex">ModuleSummaryIndex</a> &amp; Index) const</>}>
Parameters use for a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functionsummary">FunctionSummary</a>.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> collects access information of all pointer parameters. Information includes a range of direct access of parameters by the functions and all call sites accepting the parameter. StackSafety assumes that missing parameter information means possibility of access to the parameter with any offset, so we can correctly link code without StackSafety information, e.g. non-ThinLTO.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/stacksafetyanalysis-h/#l00055">55</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/stacksafetyanalysis-h">StackSafetyAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/stacksafetyanalysis-cpp/#l00941">941</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/stacksafetyanalysis-cpp">StackSafetyAnalysis.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
